definitions.definition: make musical sounds with the voice, especially words with a set tune.
synonyms: chorus; informalbelt out "the choir began to sing"

definitions.definition: perform (a song, words, or tune) with the voice.
synonyms: chorus; informalbelt out "the choir began to sing"

definitions.definition: sing in accompaniment to a song or piece of music.

synonyms: yell; informalholler "Rudy sang out a greeting"

definitions.definition: (of a bird) make characteristic melodious whistling and twittering sounds.
examples: the birds were singing in the chestnut trees

definitions.definition: make a high-pitched whistling or buzzing sound.
examples: the kettle was beginning to sing

definitions.definition: (of a person's ear) be affected with a continuous buzzing sound, especially as the aftereffect of a blow or loud noise.
examples: a stinging slap that made my ear sing

definitions.definition: act as an informer to the police.
examples: as soon as he got put under pressure, he sang like a canary
synonyms: fink on someone "he's going to sing to the police"

definitions.definition: recount or celebrate in a work of literature, especially poetry.
examples: poetry should sing the strangeness and variety of the human race
